intro: Dybowskia dybowskii, commonly known as the Dybowskia, is a rare and critically endangered plant species native to a small region in China. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is highly threatened and requires urgent conservation efforts.
